snippet: Even admirers of Raymond W. Kelly, the longest serving police commissioner in New York City’s history, wonder if it may be time to let someone else lead the department.
abstract: New York City Police Commissioner Raymond W Kelly, after years of undeniable success, is undergoing a prolonged period of turbulence, confronted with a steady drip of troublesome episodes, including several accusations of corruption and misconduct among his officers; even admirers of Kelly's 11-1/2-year tenure are beginning to wonder whether it might be time for someone else to lead the department.

byline.original: By N. R. KLEINFIELD, AL BAKER and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN

lead_paragraph: Even admirers of Raymond W. Kelly, the longest serving police commissioner in New York City’s history, wonder if it may be time to let someone else lead the department.

headline.seo: Raymond W. Kelly, N.Y.P.D. Commissioner, Runs Into Turbulence
headline.main: After 11 Years, a Police Leader Hits Turbulence
headline.print_headline: After 11 Years, A Police Leader Hits Turbulence
